guide.title: perl-cleaner Guide
guide.abstract: This document describes the functions of perl-cleaner

body.p: perl-cleaner is a tool that cleans up old perl installations, attempting to emerge --oneshot packages left over from a perl upgrade, as well as any packages that linked against the old version of libperl.so.
See the table below for possible options to pass to perl-cleaner.
body.pre: perl-cleaner needs at least one parameter from the list below. The "ask" parameter is optional. # perl-cleaner <OPTIONS> (ask)

tr.ti: rebuild perl modules for old installs of perl
rebuild perl modules for any install of perl
clean out old ph files from a previous perl
update existing ph files, useful after an upgrade to system parts like the kernel
clean out old ph files and run phupdate
rebuild modules, libperl linkages, clean ph files, and rebuild them
rebuild modules for any install of perl, libperl linkages, clean ph files, and rebuild them

body.note: Adding the parameter ask to the parameterlist of perl-cleaner will make perl-cleaner pass the --ask option to emerge commands so that you will be asked by portage before taking any actions.
